Posts.Title: Tired of husband telling me to relax! SLW SLW

Posts.Content: Feb 18, 2011 05:09PM SLW wrote: Just heard back from the nurse.  She says, Good News!  No malignancy.  Just need to follow up in six months.  I do feel a lot better.  And I know my husband will be so relieved.  But can I really put my mind at total ease?  I know I have a strong family history and seem to NEVER have a normal mammo.  Will this ever end?  The way I'm feeling now is that it is inevitable that one day I will get the "not so good news" call.  I want to get off the emotional rollercoaster.
Posts.Title: Tired of husband telling me to relax! SLW SLW

Posts.Content: Feb 18, 2011 05:18PM SLW wrote: JBinOK, I did NOT know that.  I seem to always hear about my "strong family history" everytime I see a doctor.  Good to know.  Actually, that helps a little.  Thanks!
Posts.Title: Tired of husband telling me to relax! SLW SLW
Tired of husband telling me to relax! SLW SLW

Posts.Content: SLW wrote: Hello, All -- Long story short .... I'm waiting to get the results of a stereotactic biopsy taken yesterday, and it's driving me CRAZY!  I know my husband means well, and he is such a sweetheart and goes with me to all my appointments/procedures.  But I'm so sick of him telling me to "relax."  Really?  How do I do that?  My sister died from breast cancer four years ago.  She was only 46.  So I MAY be a little paranoid.  But for the past three years, I've gone through every type of biopsy there is, being called back every six months for more follow-up.  What an emotional rollercoaster!  My most recent mammo showed calcifications that the radiologist said "most likely" would be found to be "precancerous" or "atypical."  From the research I've done today on the Internet, I'm more confused than ever and more scared.  The waiting is killing me.  And if my husband tells me to "try to relax" again, I'm going to scream!  Any tips for "dealing" with husbands would be most appreciated!  Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Tired of husband telling me to relax! SLW SLW

Posts.Content: Feb 18, 2011 02:41PM SLW wrote: I think I will quote you, Marie.  Love it!  Thanks so much!
